section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਪਿੰਡਿ ਮੂਐ ਜੀਉ ਕਿਹ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਤਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the body dies, where does the soul go?

transliteration.text: pind mūai jīu kih ghar jātā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It is absorbed into the untouched, unstruck melody of the Word of the Shabad.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: Only one who knows the Lord realizes Him.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The mind is satisfied and satiated, like the mute who eats the sugar candy and just smiles, without speaking. ||1||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਮਨ ਰੇ ਪਵਨ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਸੁਖਮਨ ਨਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mind, hold your breath steady within the central channel of the Sushmanaa. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: man rē pavan drir sukhaman nārī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਸੋ ਗੁਰੁ ਕਰਹੁ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਕਰਨਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Adopt such a Guru, that you shall not have to adopt another again.

transliteration.text: sō gur karah j bahur n karanā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਸੋ ਪਦੁ ਰਵਹੁ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਰਵਨਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Dwell in such a state, that you shall never have to dwell in any other.

transliteration.text: sō pad ravah j bahur n ravanā .

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. text: ਸੋ ਧਿਆਨੁ ਧਰਹੁ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਧਰਨਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Embrace such a meditation, that you shall never have to embrace any other.

transliteration.text: sō dhiān dharah j bahur n dharanā .

text: ਐਸੇ ਮਰਹੁ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਮਰਨਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Die in such a way, that you shall never have to die again. ||2||

transliteration.text: aisē marah j bahur n maranā .2.

translation.text: Turn your breath away from the left channel, and away from the right channel, and unite them in the central channel of the Sushmanaa.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: At their confluence within your mind, take your bath there without water.

translation.text: To look upon all with an impartial eye - let this be your daily occupation.

translation.text: Contemplate this essence of reality - what else is there to contemplate? ||3||

translation.text: Water, fire, wind, earth and ether

translation.text: Says Kabeer, meditate on the Immaculate Lord.

text: ਤਿਤੁ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਉ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਆਵਉ ॥੪॥੧੮॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Go to that home, which you shall never have to leave. ||4||18||

transliteration.text: tit ghar jāu j bahur n āvau .4.18.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective.
